page.title: 04Houses in Sheerness
page.content: Most of the houses are small and terraced but along the sea front are larger grand 3 and 4 storied ones of the late{19th century.}Further from the town centre are detached and semi- detached properties, the larger having been converted into{flats.} A feature of the sea-front is the row of tall terraced houses known as "Shrimp Terrace" because of the colour of the stone. Behind the town centre are streets of terraced properties most of which have no front garden and only a small back one. At the backs of these houses there is a network of alleys. The{terraced houses}are in narrow roads lined with parked cars which makes the roads difficult to drive down. Much of the{housing}is owner occupied but some is privately rented.
